thread.title: Brooks to get a top News Corp spot: report
thread.title_full: Brooks to get a top News Corp spot: report

title: Brooks to get a top News Corp spot: report
text:
View Photo 

Rebekah Brooks will return to News Corp as chief executive of its UK division a year after she was cleared in the phone hacking trial, it's been reported. 
Britain's Financial Times says Brooks is set to return to the senior job, and the announcement could be made as soon as early September. 
Brooks, who edited The Sun and The News of the World in a long career at the organisation, quit the job four years ago at the height of the hacking scandal. 
She was cleared of all charges following a 138-day trial, and speculation has grown in recent months that she will be making a return to the firm. 
A spokeswoman for News Corp said on Friday: "As we have said before, we have been having discussions with Rebekah Brooks and when we have any announcements to make we will let you know." @YahooNZBusiness on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Brooks to get a top News Corp spot: report AAP
